tn.text: "It came about" marks a point of special significance in the story. At: "At the very time when"
AT: "and both Israel and Judah followed him in his sin." Israel also includes Judah here. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]] )
See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]]
AT: "came to attack"
AT: "Many soldiers" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]]

tn.ref: so I have also given you over into Shishak's hand
tn.text: AT: "so I have given you to Shishak as captives" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] )
AT: "the king and the other leaders of Israel had humbled themselves," - The king and other leaders are symbolic of all the people of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"Yahweh spoke his word." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:2ch:11:02|11:2]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: I will rescue them to some extent
tn.text: AT: "I will rescue them from complete destruction"

tn.ref: my anger will not pour out on Jerusalem
tn.text: AT: "I will not completely express my anger against Jerusalem"

tn.ref: entrusted them into the hands of the commanders
tn.text: AT: "gave them to the commanders" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
marks a time of special significance in the story. Many languages have a way to mark this significant time phrase.

tn.ref: Yahweh's anger turned away from him, so as not to destroy him completely
tn.text: AT: "Yahweh was no longer angry with him and, thus, did not destroy him completely" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
"in addition"

tn.ref: so that he might put his name there.
tn.text: AT: "so that he would always be honored there." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: he did not fix his heart to seek Yahweh
tn.text: AT: "he did not have the desire and strength to obey God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]]
"everything" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
